Sociology and Social Network Theory

Social network theorists study the interactions of individuals and groups by analyzing the pattern of their connections. These patterns can typically be represented as graphs; graph drawing provides an important way of understanding these graphs.

  • Gallery of social structures, L. Krempel, Max-Planck-Inst. Köln. Graph drawing applications in sociology.

  • International Network for Social Network Analysis.

Part of Geometry in Action, a collection of applications of computational geometry.
David Eppstein, Theory Group, ICS, UC Irvine.
